reviews.review:
Makes me want to cry regularly
10/10

Before writing the rest of this review, I want to say that I am not someone who plays this game to 'win'. If I get hooked, I get hooked; if I am sacrificed, I am sacrificed. So 'balance', 'survivor vs. killer', etc. does not count into this review.

But sadly I have to give a thumbs down, since with the new update, the game will become unplayable for me.
I am hard of hearing and since the PC version lacks any accessibility options (which the mobile version has!) I had to rely on the perk Spinechill to be aware of the killer's presence. The perk is getting heavily nerfed, to the point where it is completely useless. I would not have minded it at all, if they would have deactivated the perk when playing against killers that don't have a heartbeat, since, yes, this is one of the instances where the perk gives me information I shouldn't have.  
After the fauxpas with one of the dev team mocking color blind people, you would think that the dev team would be especially interested in fixing the lack of accessability options, but nope, still unadressed. 

With all the other perk changes, I wouldn't have cared, even though some changes to the gameplay are utterly stupid (like increasing the generator time-a tedious activity that is pretty much forcing the player into a passive role becomes even more tedious and boring. There would have been other ways of slowing down survivors, but these would have required more effort, I guess). I adapt to changes, but the spinechill change is literally something I can't adapt to, because I can't just get rid of my disability. 

In general, you should not buy this game if you are expecting it to actually 'evolve'; things are tweaked and added (to the point where the devs apparently don't understand potential synergies themselves anymore) but real changes that would probably have a greater (potentially positive) impact on game balance don't take place anymore.

Art direction is nice. Choice of licenses is good. Lore is fine. Game bugs are funny at best and absolutely infuriating at worst.
It's fun, there's a lot of room for growth, and while there is paid add-ons, they're not needed to be good or to win matches

Do devs listen? No.
Is the game fun? No
Is the game balanced? No
Is the community toxic? Yes
Will i continue to play? Yes

A large portion of the online players play a balanced game and enough having fun. There are those that take it too seriously though. All in all a good time.

its a horrible game, 10/10.

survivor in a nutshell:

-run
-get camped
-not even scary at that point just really annoying
-sweaty

killer in a nutshell:

-get camped
-waste an entire game from one sweaty player baiting you into a chase for 10 minutes
-they should swap roles, survivor players basically own killers
-if youre trying to have fun, you wont.
-survivors being the most pesky bugs known on earth

this games community and fanbase is incredibly toxic to the point its not fun to play whatsoever but as a hungry horror fan i cant help but keep coming back despite it all. if you are a person who is easily agitated at video games i wouldnt suggest this, unless you play survivor because theyre the ones who get a load off for some reason

This game isnt anything special, the upcoming 4v1 horror games are doing what dead by daylight never could. which is make a game thats actually good. If your reading this dont download the game and save yourself 7 bucks, which is expensive for this low quality game. should be 3 bucks, or free. If you want a 4v1 style game like this try the new evil dead one! Quick note: the devs of this game, behaviour suck.
